ygData.subject: Re: specialization
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, let s... Personally I really like this skill they implemented, And me well i think i m gonna put it in alteration cause some of my Damage spells are
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, let's...
Personally I really like this skill they implemented,
And me well i think i'm gonna put it in alteration
cause some of my Damage spells are alteration most of
my changing spells +root and group spells are
alteration. And Enchanters ARE supposed to control the
battles and morhp it to what they wan't. It would be
cool to cast faster and cheaper. Course you do have a
good point evocation is our major damage spells and
costs lots of mana and is needed for soloing. course
at higher levels it's really high to solo but for
enchanter's they can solo, so if you like soloing go
for evo. If you like to do both go ahead and put it in
Evo cause while everyoe is attackin you still have
<Time> which is the key part to this skill to cast
your debuff spells. Evo is slow and costly in mana.
for those of you that like to just go groups a lot
more than solo go ahead on alteration but me
personally i'm gonna go through all spells and see
what skill they take than decide.
Also is there a list i can find to find all the
advantages an minor illusion has? Ie:
Darkelf get's ultra vision
Humans get's Bonus exp? I think?
i'm not even sure but i think there is SOMEHOW an
advantage to each kind of race like the fire elemental
having super damage.
I could use a list like this.
The Wanderer

--- HiFi Review <hifireview@...> wrote:
> From: HiFi Review <hifireview@...>
>
> seems to be a good time to discuss specialization,
> now that it is
> available.
>
> We can choose one primary specialization. Which do
> you guys plan to
> choose? Alteration seems to be the obvious choice
> for enchanters, as
> most of our bread and butter spells are of that
> type. However, our DD
> spells are evocation and our illusions are
> divination. Do any of you
> think that these spells are more important? Is it
> possible that an
> enchanter specializing in evocation could go toe to
> toe with a wizard?
> Or is the spell delay issue still going to be a
> problem? Do any of you
> spend your entire existence in an illusion form,
> such as elemental or
> spirit wolf?
>
> Let's all put in our two coppers on specialization,
> shall we?
>
